triageFlags.title: Excessive Debt-to-Income Ratio
triageFlags.description: The applicant's Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to affordability concerns.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, the maximum DTI for Tier B applicants is 40%. The applicant's DTI of 55% significantly exceeds this limit, indicating potential financial strain.

triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio is higher than the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to non-compliance with LTV policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 100% for Tier B applicants. The current LTV of 91.11% is above this threshold, indicating a higher risk of financial exposure.

content.reasoning: The applicant's DTI ratio of 55% exceeds the maximum allowable 40% for Tier B, indicating affordability concerns. Additionally, the LTV ratio of 91.11% surpasses the 100% limit for Tier B, further breaching policy guidelines. These factors collectively present a high risk.
